project.teaser: ELABORATOR uses a holistic approach for planning, designing, implementing and deploying specific innovations and interventions towards safe, inclusive and sustainable urban mobility. These interventions, consist of smart enforcement tools, space redesign and dynamic...
project.objective: ELABORATOR uses a holistic approach for planning, designing, implementing and deploying specific innovations and interventions towards safe, inclusive and sustainable urban mobility. These interventions, consist of smart enforcement tools, space redesign and dynamic allocation, shared services, and integration of active and green modes of transportation. They will be specifically co-designed and co-created with identified “vulnerable to exclusion” user groups, local authorities and relevant stakeholders. The interventions will be demonstrated in 6 Lighthouse and 6 Follower cities across Europe with three principal aims: i) to collect, assess and analyse user needs and requirements towards a safe and inclusive mobility and climate neutral cities; ii) to collect and share rich information sets made of real data, traces from dedicated toolkits, users’ and stakeholders’ opinions among the cities, so as to increase the take up of the innovations via a twinning approach and iii) to generate detailed guidelines, policies, future roadmap and built capacity for service providers, planning authorities and urban designers for the optimum integration of such inclusive and safe mobility interventions into Sustainable Urban Mobility Plans (SUMPs). The Lighthouse cities are: Milan (Italy), Copenhagen (Denmark), Helsinki (Finland), Issy-les-Moulineaux (France), Zaragoza (Spain) and Trikala (Greece). The Follower cities are Lund (Sweden), Liberec (Czech Republic), Velejne (Slovenia), Ioannina (Greece), Split (Croatia) and Krusevac (Serbia).
project.title: THE EUROPEAN LIVING LAB ON DESIGNING SUSTAINABLE URBAN MOBILITY TOWARDS CLIMATE NEUTRAL CITIES
project.keywords: 12 European cities, co-creation, citizen-science based toolkits, inclusion plan, twinning among cities

article.title: Holistic interventions for safe, inclusive, sustainable cities

result.title: Project management plan
result.description: Describing the governance bodies the relevant meetings management tools as well the internal rules and procedures relating to or complementing the Grant Agreement and the Consortium Agreement and including the risk management procedures Linked to T11 Interim and final periodic reports

result.title: Innovation management plan
result.description: Presenting the project plan for dealing with innovation and define the methodology to ensure the outcome of the project meets the need of the market and the end users Linked to T12

result.title: The ELABORATOR co-creation playbook
result.description: This report will outline practical guidelines to implement co-creation methodology in all ELABORATOR cities and will define the engagement strategy and propose all potential participatory methods available (Linked to T2.2).

result.title: Data domain protocol for transport research
result.description: This report will design a model DMP template that is re-usable and address key policies, standards, methods and tools needed to FAIRify and publish data in Open Access (Linked to T1.3)

result.title: Evaluation plan
result.description: This deliverable will report the methodology to be followed and the KPIs to be used initially in the need-gap analysis of T3.1 as well as in the actual evaluation and assessments of WP7. The proposed KPIs will be aligned with the SUMIs and focus on assessing environmental, social and safety (Linked to T2.2)

result.title: Technical definitions of the Lighthouse cities interventions – version I
result.description: This deliverable will be the document reporting the initial definition of interventions containing actions and plans used to implement each of the local interventions, together with the datasets definitions (Linked to T3.3)

result.title: Enforcer twinning: Guidelines and templates towards the cross-case co-creation process
result.description: This report will entail the format of cross-site cooperation needed within the enforcer and beyond to efficiently port interventions co-created in terms of design by Lighthouse and Follower cities (Linked to T3.2)

result.title: Data management plan – version II
result.description: Will provide an updated DMP at the end of reporting period 1 (M01-M18) (Linked to T1.3)

result.title: Dissemination and communication strategy, plan and tools – version I
result.description: This report will define the overall strategy and plan for communication and dissemination and tools to be used for promoting ELABORATOR Also the dissemination and outreach KPIs will be finalized Linked to T81

result.title: Feasibility and action plans for the ELABORATOR interventions – version I
result.description: This deliverable will report the local initial activities of the LLs cataloguing actors and their expectations from the interventions, together with any past actions relevant, data collected, and lessons learned (Linked to T3.1)

result.title: Data management plan – version I
result.description: will provide a 1st version DMP with a complete set of guidelines including the description of the data and data management tools for accessing and using the data for research purposes Linked to T13

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - ELABORATOR (THE EUROPEAN LIVING LAB ON DESIGNING SUSTAINABLE URBAN MOBILITY TOWARDS CLIMATE NEUTRAL CITIES)
result.teaser: Urban mobility plays a critical role in addressing environmental sustainability, social inclusion, and economic resilience. However, cities across Europe face challenges such as traffic congestion, air pollution, limited accessibility, and mobility inequities, which hinder...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Mobility intervention data framework
result.description: This report will serve as a guiding principle for recording, storing, indexing, querying, and distributing of relevant data (Linked to T4.1)

result.title: Brand identity and guidelines
result.description: This deliverable will define the branding of ELABORATOR including the office templates logos etc to be used for the dissemination purposed of the project Linked to T81

result.title: ELABORATOR technological toolkits for co-creation
result.description: This Deiliverable will report the specification, characteristics and ways of usage of the Diagnostic Mobility Labkit, the Mobility Citizen Science Kit and the Mobility co-design videogame (Linked to T2.4)

result.title: Inclusion plan
result.description: Will report the specific framework (tools, guidelines, etc.) to be followed throughout the project in order to guarantee inclusivity. This includes the inclusivity plan and the inclusivity indicators to be used throughout the whole project (Linked to T2.1).

result.title: Approach to ensure inclusiveness for the identification of real mobility and public space re-design needs towards sustainability

details.authors: Anna Antonakopoulou, Eva Grigoriadou, Pinelopi Alexiou, Ioulia Leventopoulou, Iasonas Sioutis, Vasilis Sourlas, Angelos Amditis, Evangelia Latsa
details.journalTitle: AHFE International, Human Factors in Architecture, Sustainable Urban Planning and Infrastructure

result.title: Designing an Evaluation Methodology for the Living Labs of the ELABORATOR Project

details.authors: J. Broz, V. Angelakis, M. Penttinen, A. Schon, A. Jain, T. Tichy, F. Del-Busto, I. Sioutis, T. S. Nese, I. Grundel, T. A. Carstensen

result.title: Quality management plan
result.description: This Report will provide a single point of reference for the quality management processes implemented during the project It sets the basis for highquality project outcomes and primarily applies to deliverable management reporting and dissemination activities It also describes the project organisation roles and responsibilities related to Quality Assurance QA and Quality Control QC activities QA comprises managerial actions aiming at highquality output whereas QC is used to verify the quality of the output Linked to T14

result.title: Feasibility and action plans for the ELABORATOR interventions – version II
result.description: This deliverable will report the final local activities of the LLs cataloguing actors and their final expectations from the interventions (Linked to T3.1)

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
